item.name: Initialize Known Data
Initialize Known School Ids
Composites
Feature: Composites support Get request patterns
Initialize Known
Initialize Known Staff Data for Get Requests
Initialize Known Student Data for Get Requests
Composite GetById request uses an invalid resource identifier
Not a GUID

exec: pm.test("Should return a message indicating the supplied resource identifier is invalid.", () => {

request.description:
Scenario Outline: Composite GetById request uses an invalid resource identifier
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the "StudentById" composite with a resource identifier of "<id>"
    Then the response should contain a 400 Bad Request failure indicating that "The supplied resource identifier is invalid."

    Examples:
    
    | id                                  | comment                                                           |
    | abc                                 | Not a GUID                                                        |
    | XE736023-A4B6-42CE-9C3238A8520CD7D1 | Format is acceptable (hypens), but X is not a valid hex digit     |
    | XE736023A4B642CE9C3238A8520CD7D1    | Format is acceptable (no hyphens), but X is not a valid hex digit |
    | AE736023-A4B6-42CE9C3238A8520CD7D1  | Digits are valid, but format is invalid (missing hyphen)          |

Request filters using a date range inclusive

exec: // TODO: Per ODS-3610 (https://tracker.ed-fi.org/browse/ODS-3610), pure dates should not be returned by the Composites API with the time portion, and so eventually this function should be removed.
pm.test("Should return some items for verification", () => {
pm.test("Should only return staff with birth dates in the supplied range", () => {
// NOTE: Composite API is serializing dates with time portions -- this is technically incorrect
// For now we need to strip the times before comparing to avoid time zone madness.
// Make sure the birth date is >= the minimum or <= the maximum
// Establish a minimum date range using the smallest known birth date
// Save the value for this scenario only
// Get the next larger birth date as the max (skipping any birth dates that happen to be the same)
// Save the value for this scenario only

request.description:
Scenario: Request filters using a date range
     Given the subject of the request is "Staff" with range
     | PropertyName | BeginValue | EndValue   | BeginInclusion | EndInclusion |
     | BirthDate    | 1966-06-24 | 1985-09-04 | >=             | <=           |
     When a GET (all) request is submitted to the "StaffByRange" composite with a range query
     Then the response model should contain correct records with values within the specified criteria

item.name: Feature: Composites support URL based pagination
Initialize Known Data
Initialize Known Student Data for Paging Requests

exec: pm.test("Should have at least 27 items available for testing this feature.", () => {

item.name: Valid Paging Scenarios
no paging parameters

exec: pm.test("Should return one page of 25 items", () => {
pm.test("Should include exactly the first page of items", () => {

request.description:
Scenario: Composite is requested using no paging parameters
    Given the basis of the scenario is the first "25" items in the "Staff" resource
    When a GET (all) request is submitted to the "StaffFilter" composite for pagination
    Then the response should contain result items "1" to "25"

item.name: page size parameter

exec: pm.test("Should return the number of items specified by the 'limit' parameter", () => {
pm.test("Should include the first few items, up to the number requested", () => {

request.description:
Scenario: Composite is requested using page size parameter
    Given the basis of the scenario is the first "2" items in the "Staff" resource
    When a GET (all) request is submitted to the "StaffFilter" composite for pagination with parameters [limit=2]
    Then the response should contain result items "1" to "2"

        | Name  | Value |
        | LiMiT | 2     |
    Then the response should contain result items "1" to "2"

request.description:

    Given the subject of the request is a student with values in all name properties
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the "StudentProperty" composite with the following parameters:
    | Name   | Value                                   |
    | fields | studentUniqueId, firstName, lastSurname |
